images.caption: Figure 1:Figure illustrating the overall schematic of the CheXGenBench benchmark for evaluating text-to-image models in synthetic radiograph generation. CheXGenBench organises evaluation into three dimensions:Fidelity(measuring generative quality and mode coverage),Privacy(assessing memorisation and re-identification risks), andUtility(evaluating practical value of synthetic samples through image classification and radiology report generation metrics) through 20+ metrics across 11 widely-adoptedT2I models.

images.caption: Figure 3:Figure depicting the distribution of pathology counts for the 14 different conditions present in the MIMIC dataset. We indicate pathologies with there abbreviations.Note:AT(Atelectasis),CM(Cardiomegaly),CD(Consolidation),ED(Edema),EC(Enlarged Cardiomediastinum),Frac.(Fracture),LL(Lung Lesion),LO(Lung Opacity),NF(No Finding),PE(Pleural Effusion),PO(Pleural Other),PN(Pneumonia),PT(Pneumothorax),SD(Support Devices).
